comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: The cap badge suggests he worked for the White Star Shipping Line, a broad bi-tailed pennant with a white star on a red background. Looking at the picture, it's difficult to say if this badge is stitched cloth or enamelled brass? www.crwflags.com/fotw/flags/gb~hfcu.html#cun (White Star Lines, 1867 – 1968. Now sails under the Cunard flag). Stuart.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Thanks a mil, Stu, have changed description of this pic accordingly. Would you know what rank the cap might signify, above the rank and file, surely??
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03] Can't tell the rank from the cap badge alone. The insignia to watch out for would be the cuff bands or the arrangement of pips/button on the epaulettes.
Stuart.
